definition: Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: Proletariat prosperous Si's waiting, testimony that to be continued love.
sentences.chinese: 普羅旺斯的等待，見證那未完待續的愛。

sentences.english: Provence is the home of perfumery.
sentences.chinese: 普羅旺斯是香水業的發源地。

sentences.english: Provence wait to witness the love that to be continued.
sentences.chinese: 普羅旺斯的等待，見證那未完待續的愛。

sentences.english: Provence is in the south of France.
sentences.chinese: 普羅旺斯位於法國南部。

sentences.english: And I really liked the city of Providence that Brown is located in.
sentences.chinese: 而且，布朗大學坐落於普羅旺斯，我很喜歡這個城市。

sentences.english: They started wittering on about their last trip to Provence .
sentences.chinese: 他們開始喋喋不休地談論上次的普羅旺斯之行。

sentences.english: Furano, Hokkaido, Japan and therefore known as the Eastern Provence.
sentences.chinese: 日本北海道的富良野也因此被譽爲了東方的普羅旺斯。

sentences.english: I love your Monday night soups quickly whirled together and laced with mushrooms and herbes de Provence.
sentences.chinese: 我愛你週一晚上配上蘑菇和普羅旺斯的香料的湯。

sentences.english: She came for me in the rue de provence, quite delighted.
sentences.chinese: 她非常高興地又回到普羅旺斯街來找我。

sentences.english: Grilled black cod filet, "aioli Provencale", steamed vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 烤銀鱈魚，普羅旺斯汁，蒸蔬匯。

sentences.english: Provence, the city which is full of lavender …
sentences.chinese: 普羅旺斯這座城市是薰衣草的花海。

sentences.english: Olives look romantic on a hillside in Provence.
sentences.chinese: 普羅旺斯一處山坡上的橄欖林呈現出一派浪漫風情。

sentences.english: A mature mulberry tree in Provence.
sentences.chinese: 普羅旺斯一棵成熟的桑樹。

sentences.english: Provence, a town arrounded by flowers.
sentences.chinese: 普羅旺斯，一個開滿花的小鎮。

sentences.english: The sunny charm of France joie de vivre sparkles in Provence.
sentences.chinese: 在普羅旺斯到處閃爍着法國陽光的魅力。

sentences.english: Of the many festivals hosted by Aix-en-Provence each year, the Festival of Tambourines is one of the most popular.
sentences.chinese: 普羅旺斯艾克斯每年都舉辦各種多樣性的文化藝術節。

definition: Bohemia, historical country of central Europe
Bohemia, historical country of central Europe
